archive.title: Fix /api/models/set ENOENT crash in Docker
archive.description: Applied multi-path fallback (commit 62b4286)

archive.title: Create role-based skills for all agents (skill-first context)
archive.description: Per SoLo: create as many skills as possible so always-loaded context stays minimal. Create per-role skills (EXEC/COO/CFO/CMP/SEC/SMM/DEV/Family/Tax) containing SOPs + trigger descriptions; keep no secrets.

archive.title: Cleanup always-loaded context files (move SOPs to skills/references)
archive.description: Reduce token load: trim AGENTS/TOOLS/USER/MEMORY/HEARTBEAT/SOUL/RUNNING-CONTEXT. Move SOP/how-to blocks into non-always-loaded references or skill docs. Keep critical rules. Provide review + learnings.

archive.title: Debug Minimax API integration (401 invalid key)
archive.description: Investigated Minimax API errors on OpenClaw. Found minimax-cn provider has no auth key configured. minimax-portal provider returns HTTP 401 ‚Äî API key sk-cp-aGyk8ODc... is invalid/expired. User needs to regenerate key from Minimax portal and update auth-profiles.json under minimax:default and minimax-portal:default.

archive.title: Set up task board tracking workflow
archive.description: Created dashboard-tasks.py CLI tool (Python) for managing tasks and activity log via dashboard HTTP API with local file fallback. Updated AGENTS.md with mandatory task board protocol. Updated TOOLS.md with dashboard Docker internal URL (solobot-dashboard:80) and quick commands.

archive.title: SoLoBot-Android: Remove password prompt on gateway connect
archive.description: Removed password dialog from Android app. promptForPassword() now calls connectDirect() which skips password and connects immediately using Ed25519 device token auth. Deleted PasswordDialog composable. Files changed: MainActivity.kt, MainViewModel.kt.

archive.title: SoLoBot-Android: Add model selection in settings
archive.description: Added model selection dropdown in Android Settings screen. Uses sessions.patch RPC to set model per-session (matches dashboard behavior). Models grouped by provider with context window and reasoning info displayed. Files: MainViewModel.kt, SettingsScreen.kt.

archive.title: SoLoBot-Android: Color code agents in header (match dashboard)
archive.description: Applied per-agent color coding to FilterChip components in ChatScreen.kt using getAgentColor() helper. Colors match dashboard exactly: main=#BC2026, dev=#6366F1, exec=#F59E0B, coo=#10B981, cfo=#EAB308, cmp=#EC4899, family=#14B8A6, tax=#78716C, sec=#3B82F6.

archive.title: SoLoBot-Android: Add dashboard theme system
archive.description: Added System/Dark/Light theme selector in Settings. Theme preference persisted via DeviceAuthStore DataStore. Applied Material3 dynamic theming. Files changed: MainActivity.kt, MainViewModel.kt, SettingsScreen.kt, DeviceAuthStore.kt.

archive.title: SoLoBot-Android: Full audit & improvements
archive.description: Removed debug println and visible debug text from TTS UI. Fixed branding moltbot‚ÜíSoLoBot throughout. Fixed cleanMessageContent() regex that was incorrectly stripping curly braces from message content. Added TTS/reply tag cleanup. Fixed duplicate HorizontalDivider in chat.

archive.title: Fix task board data persistence ‚Äî prevent wipes on sync/redeploy
archive.description: Implemented 3-layer data protection: (1) Server /api/sync now compares item counts and never overwrites with fewer items for tasks, activity, or notes. (2) Client syncToServer() fetches server state first, skips pushing if local has fewer items. (3) Client loadState() keeps whichever source (server vs localStorage) has more data and pushes preserved data back. Files: server.js, dashboard.js. Pushed to GitHub, container restarted.

archive.title: Android: clickable links + reply notifications
archive.description: Implemented clickable links in chat messages via ChatMarkdown.kt using ClickableText + URL detection and link styling. Added ChatNotificationHelper with reply notification channel + preview. Added NodeRuntime observer to trigger notifications when app backgrounded, with dedupe signature and foreground check. Changes committed in SoLoBot-Server (commit 1ff64a38c).

archive.title: Cross-session notifications (Dashboard + Android)
archive.description: Add notification support for messages from agents when user is not in that session. Dashboard: browser Web Notifications API + visual badge on session tabs. Android: local notifications when messages arrive for non-foreground sessions. Both use WebSocket connection to gateway.

archive.title: Fix browser caching ‚Äî no more hard refresh needed
archive.description: Added Cache-Control headers to server.js static file serving. HTML/JS/CSS files now use no-cache + ETag (MD5 hash) so browser always revalidates ‚Äî gets 304 if unchanged, fresh file if changed. Images cached 1 hour. /api/state uses no-store. SPA fallback also gets no-cache + ETag. Deployed via Coolify auto-deploy. Files changed: server.js.

archive.title: Fix notification click ‚Üí navigate to chat + correct agent
archive.description: Fixed browser notification onclick handler to also call showPage('chat') and setActiveSidebarAgent() so clicking a notification navigates to the chat page and highlights the correct agent in the sidebar, not just switching the session key. File changed: dashboard.js.

archive.title: Kanban board: sorting, filtering, and workflow features
archive.description:
Added comprehensive kanban board features:

TOOLBAR (new, above columns):
- üîç Search: live-filters across titles + descriptions as you type
- Sort dropdown: Newest first, Oldest first, Priority high‚Üílow, Priority low‚Üíhigh, A‚ÜíZ, Z‚ÜíA
- Priority filter: All / P0 (üî¥) / P1 (üü°) / P2 (üü¢)
- Agent filter: auto-populated dropdown from all tasks, shows agent-colored options
- Bulk actions: appears when tasks selected ‚Äî bulk Done, Archive, Delete with confirmation
- Task stats: 'X tasks ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ Y% done' running summary

TASK CARDS (enhanced):
- Agent color tag chip on each card (matches sidebar agent colors)
- Description preview: first 80 chars shown inline under title
- Relative age: 'today', '1d ago', '5d ago' etc.
- Quick ‚ñ∂ Start button on To-Do cards (moves to In Progress)
- Column header counts show filtered/total when filters active (e.g. '3/7')

AGENT DETECTION:
- Primary: task.agent field (CLI script now sets this automatically as 'dev')
- Fallback: title prefix + keyword heuristic (android‚Üídev, marketing‚Üícmp, etc.)

FILES: index.html (toolbar HTML), dashboard.js (+231 lines sorting/filtering/rendering logic), dashboard-tasks.py (agent field)
Pushed to GitHub, Coolify auto-deploying.

archive.title: Redesign kanban toolbar ‚Äî compact single-row layout
archive.description: Redesigned kanban toolbar from 4 stacked full-width rows (~120px tall) to a single compact horizontal row (~26px tall). Search field capped at 160px, dropdowns use short labels (Newest, P*, Agent), bulk actions are tiny icon buttons only shown when needed, stats pushed to far right. All controls visible at a glance without dominating the board. File: index.html. Pushed to GitHub, Coolify auto-deploying.

archive.title: Fix cross-session notifications + sidebar unread badges
archive.description: Applied permanent fix in Coolify Traefik: added no-cache response headers middleware for sbdash/solobotdash HTML, updated compose labels, removed orphan router container, restarted proxy. External now returns Cache-Control: no-store and index.html references dashboard.js?v=3.53.1. Stale HTML caching resolved; SMM sidebar + notifications should persist.

archive.title: Adjust toast colors + duration to match theme
archive.description: Updated notification toast styling to follow theme CSS vars (card-bg/text-primary/text-secondary), use agent color as accent only. Increased auto-dismiss to 12s. Added softer shadow + backdrop blur.

archive.title: Fix session model persistence when switching sessions
archive.description: Implemented per-session model persistence: added applySessionModelOverride() to sync model/provider from sessions list, called on connect and after switchToSession. Uses availableSessions model and refreshes sessions if needed.

archive.title: Ensure provider sticks with session model
archive.description: Ensured provider dropdown syncs to session model on changeSessionModel (add missing provider option + set value). Deployed.

archive.title: ‚úÖ Test task - SoLoBot can now track tasks
Investigate SMM session losing conversation history
archive.description: Investigated SMM session losing history. Root cause: gateway context compaction. SMM session was running heavy browser automation (tool calls eating tokens), causing the gateway to compact older messages. Not a dashboard bug. Explained to SoLo.

archive.title: Increase compaction threshold for SMM agent
archive.description: Set SMM agent compaction override in openclaw.json: maxHistoryShare=0.8 (up from default 0.5), reserveTokensFloor=4096, memoryFlush enabled. This keeps 80% of context window for history instead of 50%, giving SMM significantly more room before compaction kicks in.

archive.title: Sync Android notification clears with dashboard read state
archive.description: Implemented read-ack sync: Dashboard sends chat.inject [[read_ack]] when unread cleared; gateway-client ignores read-ack for notifications; dashboard ignores read-ack in chat display. Android clears unread/notification on read-ack in both active and cross-session handlers.

archive.title: Update OpenClaw to latest upstream
archive.description: Ran gateway update.run. Update skipped because install is not a git checkout (not-git-install). Gateway restart signal emitted. Current version remains 2026.2.3.

archive.title: Fix session model/provider persistence on session switch
archive.description: Fixed model/provider not persisting on session switch. Root cause: applySessionModelOverride did nothing when session had no model set, leaving stale UI from previous session. Fix: 3-tier fallback ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ (1) cached availableSessions, (2) fresh sessions.list from gateway, (3) global default from openclaw.json via config.get. Commit 9fb0b4e.

archive.title: Fix dashboard text selection/copy-paste issues
archive.description: Task cards onclick handler fires when trying to select text, opening detail modal and killing selection. Also Ctrl+A hijacked for task selection instead of text. Need to check for text selection before firing click handlers.

archive.title: Secure noVNC setup for SMM agent
archive.description: Set up secure noVNC access on VPS for SMM agent desktop access. VNC on :5905, websockify on localhost:6080, nginx reverse proxy with SSL + basic auth on port 6090. Firewall: blocked direct 5905/6080, allowed 6090. Systemd services enabled for persistence. Credentials: smm / 5L5eqFguTG82/9fSUOV7tw==

archive.title: Debug VPS connectivity from container
archive.description: Root cause: UFW had no rules for ports 80/443 ‚Äî only 8080 was allowed. Added 'ufw allow 80/tcp' and 'ufw allow 443/tcp'. sbdash.sololink.cloud now returns 200 from container. SSH was unaffected (port 22 was already allowed). Internal Docker network was also unaffected.

archive.title: Dashboard: SMM agent sidebar visibility
archive.description: SMM sidebar confirmed live on external URL (sbdash.sololink.cloud). No-cache headers pushed (c7784a0). UFW port 80/443 restored. SoLo notified via sessions_send.

archive.title: Audit dashboard chat system ‚Äî reliability, sync, missing messages
archive.description: Audit found 6 bugs: (1) textContent undefined in loadHistoryMessages causing misclassification, (2) localStorage only saved 50 msgs, (3) 24h cutoff silently dropped old msgs on reload, (4) gateway only fetched 50 msgs, (5) maxMessages cap at 100, (6) mergeHistoryMessages didn't persist chat. All fixed in commit 40480b6.

archive.title: Fix chat switching bugs - wrong conversation on refresh + slow agent switching
archive.description: Root cause: chat messages stored in single global localStorage key (solobot-chat-messages) regardless of which agent session was active. Fixed by: (1) session-scoped localStorage keys (solobot-chat-{sessionKey}), (2) in-memory message cache for instant agent switching, (3) legacy key auto-migration. Pushed to solobot-dashboard main. Awaiting Coolify redeploy.

archive.title: Fix Android TTS noise/artifacts in voice playback
archive.description: Created TtsSanitizer utility that strips markdown, fenced code blocks, inline code, [[tts:]] and [[reply_to:]] tags, antml tool call XML blocks, HTML tags, bare URLs, emoji shortcodes, and noise lines (NO_REPLY, HEARTBEAT_OK, [read-sync], [[read_ack]]). Wired into TalkModeManager.playAssistant() so text is cleaned before hitting ElevenLabs or system TTS. Also added type-check filter in fetchLatestAssistantText to skip tool_use/tool_result content blocks. Added unit tests. Pushed to main.

archive.title: SoLoBot Android Session Audit
archive.description: Completed full session audit and implemented critical fixes: (1) Added sessionVersion counter to prevent stale history responses after session switches, (2) Switched all history loads from merge to full replace to eliminate cross-session message bleed, (3) Added limit=200 pagination to chat.history, (4) Fixed false message dedup using content hash, (5) Tightened addMessage dedup to ID-only, (6) Unified session key source of truth, (7) Removed premature history fetch after sendMessage, (8) Added removedSessions pruning. Files changed: MainViewModel.kt, GatewayRepository.kt. Pushed to main.

archive.title: Settings: provider+model selector, move theme to Visible Panels
archive.description: 1) Add provider dropdown to the Change Default Model section so user picks provider first, then model. 2) Move theme selection (dark/light/system) under the Visible Panels section in settings.

archive.title: Fix Coolify proxy caching ‚Äî stale HTML served externally

SMM sidebar entry missing intermittently. Need to add cache-control headers to proxy config or force Caddy to pass through without caching.

archive.title: Set CDP download directory

Need user to update service ExecStart with --download-default-directory and run systemctl --user daemon-reload/restart on host.

Auto-selects current model's provider. Sync already works bidirectionally via sessions.patch ‚Äî Android changes update dashboard, dashboard changes picked up on 5-second refresh. Pushed to main (2846e24).

archive.title: Dashboard: Remove chat widget from dashboard page
archive.description: Removed embedded Chat bento widget from pages/dashboard.html (dashboard page). Chat remains available via the dedicated Chat page. Pushed to main (812f40e).

archive.title: Dashboard: Fix recent-activity 404
archive.description: Server now special-cases /api/memory/recent-activity.json: serves from workspace/memory/recent-activity.json if present, otherwise returns empty payload to prevent console spam. Pushed (218a7cf).

archive.title: Fix Skills Manager toggle API (unknown method skills.toggle)
archive.description: Root cause: dashboard Skills Manager called non-existent gateway RPC , causing toast 'unknown method: skills.toggle'. Gateway supports  with params { skillKey, enabled }. Patched /home/node/.openclaw/workspace/solobot-dashboard/js/skills-mgr.js to call  and treat displayed name as skillKey. Committed+Pushed: 2281299.

archive.title: Fix skills.install failure visibility + npm install errors
archive.description: Diagnosed npm install failures: gateway runs as user 'node' inside moltbot container; /home/node/.npm cache had root-owned files causing EACCES. Also global npm prefix was /usr/local which wasn't writable for node. Fix applied on VPS: docker exec into moltbot container, chown -R node:node /home/node/.npm and /usr/local/bin + /usr/local/lib/node_modules; set npm prefix back to /usr/local for node user. Verified npm install -g @steipete/bird and mcporter succeed as node user.

archive.title: Install Homebrew (Linuxbrew) on gateway for skill installs
archive.description: Installed Homebrew (Linuxbrew) inside moltbot gateway container (Debian 12) so skills.install brew-based installers can run. Steps: apt-get install build-essential/curl/file/git; created /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew with node ownership; ran Homebrew install script as node (NONINTERACTIVE=1); added symlink /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/Library -> Homebrew/Library (needed for brew.sh path); created /usr/local/bin/brew wrapper to force HOMEBREW_PREFIX=/home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew so gateway PATH finds brew. Verified as node: Homebrew 5.0.14 returns Homebrew 5.0.14.

archive.title: Fix go installer (spawn go EACCES) + camsnap brew requirements
archive.description:
Diagnosed blucli install error 'spawn go EACCES': gateway container PATH lacked Linuxbrew bin, so go wasn't found/executable for skills.install go installers. Installed go via brew (already), then symlinked /home/linuxbrew/.linuxbrew/bin/go and gofmt into /usr/local/bin so gateway PATH resolves go. Also added sync to symlink Linuxbrew bin tools into /usr/local/bin for PATH visibility. Diagnosed camsnap brew failure: ==> steipete/tap/camsnap: stable 0.2.0

archive.title: Verify bird skill end-to-end
archive.description:
Verified bird skill is installed and runnable on gateway host (inside moltbot container): /usr/local/bin/bird exists and bird 0.8.0 ‚Äî fast X CLI for tweeting, replying, and reading
Usage: bird [options] [command]

Post tweets and replies via Twitter/X GraphQL API

Options:
  -V, --version                             output the version number
  --auth-token <token>                      Twitter auth_token cookie
  --ct0 <token>                             Twitter ct0 cookie
  --chrome-profile <name>                   Chrome profile name for cookie extraction
  --chrome-profile-dir <path>               Chrome/Chromium profile directory or cookie DB path for cookie extraction
  --firefox-profile <name>                  Firefox profile name for cookie extraction
  --cookie-timeout <ms>                     Cookie extraction timeout in milliseconds (keychain/OS helpers)
  --cookie-source <source>                  Cookie source for browser cookie extraction (repeatable)
  --media <path>                            Attach media file (repeatable, up to 4 images or 1 video)
  --alt <text>                              Alt text for the corresponding --media (repeatable)
  --timeout <ms>                            Request timeout in milliseconds
  --quote-depth <depth>                     Max quoted tweet depth (default: 1; 0 disables)
  --plain                                   Plain output (stable, no emoji, no color)
  --no-emoji                                Disable emoji output
  --no-color                                Disable ANSI colors (or set NO_COLOR)
  -h, --help                                display help for command

Commands:
  help [command]                            Show help for a command
  query-ids [options]                       Show or refresh cached Twitter GraphQL query IDs
  tweet <text>                              Post a new tweet
  reply <tweet-id-or-url> <text>            Reply to an existing tweet
  read [options] <tweet-id-or-url>          Read/fetch a tweet by ID or URL
  replies [options] <tweet-id-or-url>       List replies to a tweet (by ID or URL)
  thread [options] <tweet-id-or-url>        Show the full conversation thread containing the tweet
  search [options] <query>                  Search for tweets
  mentions [options]                        Find tweets mentioning a user (defaults to current user)
  bookmarks [options]                       Get your bookmarked tweets
  unbookmark <tweet-id-or-url...>           Remove bookmarked tweets
  follow <username-or-id>                   Follow a user
  unfollow <username-or-id>                 Unfollow a user
  lists [options]                           Get your Twitter lists
  list-timeline [options] <list-id-or-url>  Get tweets from a list timeline
  home [options]                            Get your home timeline ("For You" feed)
  following [options]                       Get users that you (or another user) follow
  followers [options]                       Get users that follow you (or another user)
  likes [options]                           Get your liked tweets
  whoami                                    Show which Twitter account the current credentials belong to
  about [options] <username>                Get account origin and location information for a user
  user-tweets [options] <handle>            Get tweets from a user's profile timeline
  news|trending [options]                   Fetch AI-curated news and trending topics from Explore tabs
  check                                     Check credential availability

Examples
  bird whoami
    Show the logged-in account via GraphQL cookies

  bird --firefox-profile default-release whoami
    Use Firefox profile cookies

  bird tweet "hello from bird"
    Send a tweet

  bird 1234567890123456789 --json
    Read a tweet (ID or URL shorthand for `read`) and print JSON

Shortcuts
  bird <tweet-id-or-url> [--json]
    Shorthand for `bird read <tweet-id-or-url>`

JSON Output
  Add --json to: read, replies, thread, search, mentions, bookmarks, likes, following, followers, about, lists, list-timeline, user-tweets, query-ids
  Add --json-full to include raw API response in _raw field (tweet commands only)
  (Run bird <command> --help to see per-command flags.)


Config
  Reads ~/.config/bird/config.json5 and ./.birdrc.json5 (JSON5)
  Supports: chromeProfile, chromeProfileDir, firefoxProfile, cookieSource, cookieTimeoutMs, timeoutMs, quoteDepth

Env
  NO_COLOR, BIRD_TIMEOUT_MS, BIRD_COOKIE_TIMEOUT_MS, BIRD_QUOTE_DEPTH returns bird 0.8.0 CLI help. Also confirmed global install at /usr/local/lib/node_modules/@steipete/bird.

archive.title: Switch X automation to chirp skill (browser-based)
archive.description: User chose chirp. Verified chirp skill is present in workspace skills (/home/node/.openclaw/workspace/skills/chirp/SKILL.md) and linked into agent workspace-smm. Chirp uses OpenClaw browser tool (profile=openclaw) and requires a browser installed/available to gateway. Attempted to start browser via OpenClaw browser tool in this environment; tool reports no supported browser found on this host (container). Need to run browser tool against VPS Chrome CDP (profile=vps) or install Chromium inside gateway container / configure gateway browser control service.

archive.title: Notify SMM: use chirp via VPS browser profile for X posting
archive.description: User requested informing SMM about successful X posting method: use chirp (browser automation) with VPS Chrome CDP profile=vps; bird CLI cookie decryption not reliable in container. Send instructions to agent:smm:main and ensure chirp skill is in SMM tools.

archive.title: Check VPN/Tailscale status on VPS
archive.description: SSH to 51.81.202.92: tailscale/tailscaled binaries not present; systemd unit tailscaled.service not found;  command not found; no docker containers related to tailscale; journalctl has no tailscaled logs. Conclusion: Tailscale is not installed/running on VPS, so VPN connection prompt is unrelated (it‚Äôs the noVNC basic-auth on :6900).

archive.title: Inventory existing remote access/VPN on VPS
archive.description: SSH inventory: No OpenVPN/WireGuard/Tailscale/IPSec packages or running services found. Remote access is via exposed ports: SSH 22, direct TigerVNC on 5905, noVNC via websockify serving /usr/share/novnc on 6080 -> localhost:5905, plus nginx listening on 6090 (likely virtual-host/proxy; returns 400 without proper Host header). Coolify/Traefik proxy on 80/443/8080. RustDesk server containers exposed on 21115-21119. UFW allows 5905/6080/6090/80/443/22/18789. No listener on 6900 currently, so prior :6900 prompt likely from different/old service or different host/port.

archive.title: Set up Tailscale + lock down public VNC
archive.description: Tailscale installed and authenticated successfully. VPS now online in tailnet as 100.110.172.52 (IPv6 fd7a:115c:a1e0::1501:ac9c). Locked down firewall: removed public UFW allows for 5905/6080/6090 and re-added allows only from Tailscale CGNAT range 100.64.0.0/10. Public SSH(22) and web ports (80/443/8080) unchanged. Next: user should connect VNC/noVNC using 100.110.172.52; optionally stop exposing noVNC entirely or bind VNC to localhost only.

archive.title: Fix VNC password/auth for TigerVNC
archive.description: Investigated TigerVNC auth: VNC server uses password file; hashes of /home/ubuntu/.vnc/passwd and /tmp/tigervnc*/passwd matched. Likely client incompatibility with TLSVnc/VeNCrypt. Updated systemd unit /etc/systemd/system/vncserver@.service ExecStart to force  (no TLS), reloaded daemon and restarted vncserver@5. archive.title: Fix Skills install request timeouts
archive.description: Identified root cause: gateway-client.js _request() default timeout is 15s; skills-mgr incorrectly passed timeoutMs inside params instead of 3rd arg, causing Request timeout for long installs (e.g., nano-banana-pro). Patched skills-mgr.js to call gateway._request('skills.install', {name, installId}, 600000) and pushed to main.

archive.title: Review Android chat noise filtering port
archive.description: Reviewed Android commit 0dbb9c6 (ChatScreen.isSystemNoise additions for markdown file dumps + grep output patterns). Logic is reasonable and low-risk, but introduces redundant/duplicated filters (same # length>500 rule and grep/extension regex already exist later), and uses inline Regex(...) allocations per call. Recommend refactor: consolidate duplicates, precompile regex patterns (companion object / top-level vals), and tighten the \d+[-:].*\.ext pattern to reduce false positives (e.g., file names starting with digits). No functional blocker found.

archive.title: Refactor Android isSystemNoise regex + dedupe
archive.description: Implemented cleanup in ChatScreen.isSystemNoise: removed duplicated markdown/grep blocks added by 0dbb9c6, introduced precompiled Regex constants (NOISE_GREP_FILE_LINE_REGEX, NOISE_GREP_CODE_LINE_REGEX), tightened file-line pattern to require : or - after line number and word boundary on extension, replaced inline Regex allocations with constant usage. Commit 7f61862 pushed to main. Note: local container lacks Java toolchain (JAVA_HOME missing) so could not run Gradle compile here; change is syntactically straightforward.

<final>I've completed the heartbeat check for 06:34 AM.

**Summary of Actions:**
*   **Security Remediation:** Fixed a **CRITICAL** vulnerability by re-enabling `gateway.controlUi.dangerouslyDisableDeviceAuth` and restarting the gateway.
*   **Agent Health:** Verified that Orion, Canon, and Dev have been active recently. Noted that several Antfarm runs (Planner/Setup) have been failing/timing out; I will continue to monitor this for a pattern of failure.
*   **Task Board Pulse:** High-priority tasks currently on the board include security remediation (partially addressed by the auth fix), dependency vulnerability fixes for SoLoLink/SoLoStandBy, and a git recovery task for a lost model page.
*   **Notifications:** No urgent calendar events found for today. One unread promotional email detected.

**Memory Updated:** `memory/2026-02-22.md` has been initialized with the morning's findings.

Everything else is stable. HEARTBEAT_OK.</final>
I don't think Quill has an idenity file. Can you confirm this? If he doesn't will you create one for him?

<final>I've confirmed that Quill already has a complete set of identity files in his workspace (`~/.openclaw/workspace-quill/`).

His **IDENTITY.md** identifies him as:
- **Name:** Quill
- **Title:** SoLoBot-Quill ‚Äî Frontend & UI Engineer
- **Vibe:** Creative, precise, user-focused, and detail-oriented
- **Emoji:** ‚ú®

I also verified that his `SOUL.md`, `AGENTS.md`, and other core files are present and correctly configured. He is fully set up!</final>
can you list all agents with the path of all of their core files? I want to make sure we are consistent and I want to make sure I am pointing a new UI i am working on to the proper file path

<final>Here is the list of current agents and the paths to their core identity and configuration files.

**Workspace Root:** All agent workspaces follow the naming convention `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-<agentId>/`.

| Agent | ID | Path to Core Files (`IDENTITY.md`, `SOUL.md`, `AGENTS.md`, etc.) |
|:--- |:--- |:--- |
| **Halo** | `main` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace/` (Main root) |
| **Dev** | `dev` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-dev/` |
| **Orion** | `cto` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-cto/` |
| **Elon** | `exec` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-exec/` |

| **Vector** | `cmp` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-cmp/` |
| **Atlas** | `coo` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-coo/` |
| **Knox** | `sec` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-sec/` |
| **Haven** | `family` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-family/` |
| **Luma** | `creative` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-creative/` |
| **Canon** | `docs` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-docs/` |
| **Forge** | `forge` | `/home/solo/.openclaw/workspace-forge/` |

<final>Done. I have established a new high standard for our team and retrofitted every single agent with the same requirements.

### üõ†Ô∏è New `agent-creator` Skill
I have created a permanent skill at `~/.openclaw/skills/agent-creator/`. It includes:
- **`standard-setup.md`**: A procedural guide for creating agents.
- **`IDENTITY.md.template`**: To ensure consistent naming and vibes.
- **`RUNNING_CONTEXT.md.template`**: To ensure every agent tracks their active state.
- **Mandates**: It explicitly requires that agents update **Notion** and **Google Drive** immediately upon milestone completion.

### üîÑ Team-Wide Retrofit
I didn't just plan for the future‚ÄîI've updated the entire current roster (20+ agents):
1.  **`RUNNING_CONTEXT.md` Added**: Every agent now has this file in their workspace to track their current goal and next steps.
2.  **Accountability Mandates**: I've injected the "Notion First" and "Continuous Sync" mandates into the `SOUL.md` of every agent on the team.
3.  **My Own Context**: I've updated my own `SOUL.md` and created my `RUNNING_CONTEXT.md` to lead by example.

The standard is now locked in. Every SoLoBot agent now operates with the same clear instructions for transparency and consistency.</final>

**FOUND IT!** ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ

The bug is in `syncToServer()`:
```javascript
body: JSON.stringify(state)  // Sends ENTIRE local state to server
```

And the server does:
```javascript
state = { ...state, ...update, lastSync: Date.now() };  // OVERWRITES with client state
```

**What's happening:**
1. You open dashboard in a new browser/incognito/cleared cache
2. LocalStorage is empty ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ `initSampleData()` creates empty tasks
3. Dashboard syncs that empty state ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ **WIPES server tasks**

Let me fix this ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ the server should protect tasks/notes from being overwritten with empty arrays:
[Thinking: I need to fix this sync endpoint to protect tasks and notes from being wiped. The fix should:1. If u...]
[Thinking: Good, now the server will protect tasks and notes from being wiped. Now I need to commit this fix an...]
[Thinking: Need to pull first, then push....]
[Thinking: Fix pushed. Now Coolify should auto-deploy. Let me update the terminal and give SoLo a summary....]

[Thinking: Great. The fix is deployed. Now I should explain to SoLo what was happening and what I fixed....]
**Fixed it.** Pushed to GitHub ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ Coolify will auto-deploy.

**The bug:** When you opened the dashboard in a fresh browser (or cleared cache), it loaded with empty localStorage, then synced that empty state to the server ‚Äî **wiping your tasks/notes**.

**The fix:** Server now protects tasks/notes from being overwritten if the client sends empty arrays but the server has content.

Once Coolify redeploys (usually ~1-2 min), add a test task. It should survive even if you open in incognito.

Sure. To reproduce:

1. Run `tar -czf memory-backup-$(date +%Y-%m-%d).tar.gz AGENTS.md HEARTBEAT.md MEMORY.md SOUL.md TOOLS.md USER.md memory/` (edit filename if you need a specific date).
2. Refresh the Google OAuth access token before uploading:
   ```bash
   python3 - <<'PY'
   import json, urllib.request, urllib.parse
   creds = json.load(open('config/google/client_secret.json'))['installed']
   tokens = json.load(open('config/google/tokens.json'))
   data = urllib.parse.urlencode({
       'client_id': creds['client_id'],
       'client_secret': creds['client_secret'],
       'refresh_token': tokens['refresh_token'],
       'grant_type': 'refresh_token'
   }).encode()
   req = urllib.request.Request('https://oauth2.googleapis.com/token', data=data)
   resp = json.load(urllib.request.urlopen(req))
   tokens.update({
       'access_token': resp['access_token'],
       'expires_in': resp.get('expires_in', tokens.get('expires_in')),
       'scope': resp.get('scope', tokens.get('scope')),
       'token_type': resp.get('token_type', tokens.get('token_type', 'Bearer')),
       'refresh_token_expires_in': resp.get('refresh_token_expires_in', tokens.get('refresh_token_expires_in'))
   })
   json.dump(tokens, open('config/google/tokens.json', 'w'), indent=2)
   PY
   ```
3. Upload via multipart form to Drive folder `1VEOcQA_bgfPmwDhYHd1lqMzZom1sO869` with the refreshed `access_token`. Use the same multipart structure shown earlier (metadata + file parts).

[Thinking: Web search is down. Let me give SoLo the answer from my knowledge - I know ASO pretty well....]
No web search right now, but I know this well. Here's the deal:

## Why You're Invisible

New apps have **zero authority** with Google's algorithm. You need:
1. **Downloads + velocity** (how fast you're getting them)
2. **Keyword relevance** in your listing
3. **Ratings & reviews**
4. **Engagement metrics** (retention, session length)

## Quick Wins You Can Do Today

### 1. **Nail Your Keywords**
- Put "StandBy" in your **app title** (e.g., "SoLoStandBy - StandBy Mode for Android")
- Use exact match keywords in your **short description** (first 80 chars matter most)
- Long description: naturally include "standby mode", "always on display", "bedside clock", "charging screen", etc.

### 2. **Title Format That Works**
```
SoLoStandBy: StandBy Mode & Always-On Display
```
Front-load the keywords people actually search.

### 3. **Get Initial Reviews**
- Ask friends/family to download AND leave reviews (Google weighs this heavily)
- 10-20 genuine reviews with keywords like "standby" in them helps

### 4. **Screenshots & Video**
- Show the actual StandBy screens prominently
- First 2 screenshots = most important

## The Hard Truth

For competitive keywords like "standby," you're fighting apps with thousands of downloads. Consider:
- **Long-tail keywords**: "iPhone standby mode for android", "iOS 17 standby android"
- **Run Google Ads** for a week to boost initial downloads (even $50 helps kickstart the algorithm)

You're absolutely right to question this! No, Telegram does NOT poll every 3 seconds - that would be terrible for battery life and performance. Let me explain how Telegram actually works and how we can improve our implementation.

## How Telegram Really Works:

1. **WebSocket Connections**: Telegram uses persistent WebSocket connections for real-time communication
2. **Push Notifications**: Messages are pushed instantly to connected devices
3. **Smart Sync**: Only syncs when there are actual changes
4. **Efficient Protocols**: Uses MTProto protocol optimized for mobile

## Our Current Implementation vs. Best Practice:

**Current (Not Ideal):**
- Polling every 3 seconds (wasteful)
- No connection state management
- Always-on HTTP requests

**Better Approach:**
- WebSocket for real-time updates
- Long-polling as fallback
- Event-driven architecture

You don't want me running as root permanently (security risk), but you can fix this specific permission issue via SSH to your host:

**SSH into your host, then:**

```bash
# Find the container
docker ps | grep openclaw

# Fix the config file ownership (run as root inside container)
docker exec -u root <container_name_or_id> chown node:node /home/node/.openclaw/openclaw.json /home/node/.openclaw/openclaw.json.bak*

# Or if running via Coolify, the container is probably named something like:
docker exec -u root $(docker ps -qf "name=openclaw") chown node:node /home/node/.openclaw/openclaw.json
```

**Alternative ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ fix from host filesystem directly:**
```bash
# If you know where the volume is mounted
sudo chown 1000:1000 /path/to/openclaw/data/openclaw.json
```

Once you run that, I'll be able to read and modify the config to finish setting up the personas.

[Thinking: **Preparing guidance for session creation**...]
Here‚Äôs the playbook you‚Äôd run over SSH (on the Coolify host) to grant the session control-plane privileges and create the five isolated agents. IÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩm assuming you have the OpenClaw CLI installed on that machine (`openclaw` command) and that your SSH user can call it. YouÔøΩÔøΩll use the `openclaw session create` + `openclaw session memory create` commands, then `openclaw session tool allow` to scope tools.

1. **Elevate the current session (where IÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩm running) to control-plane access.**  
   (This is usually done by editing the OpenClaw deployment config in Coolify and adding a token with `session.create`/`memory.create` privileges to the environment. If you already have an API token, set it as `OPENCLAW_TOKEN` before running the commands below.)

2. **Create each agent session + memory lane (run once per agent):**

```bash
# replace <token> with your control-plane token if needed
export OPENCLAW_TOKEN=<control_plane_token>

# create session, e.g. "solovision-coo"
openclaw session create --label="solovision-coo" --description="COO agent" --model="openai/gpt-5.2" --sessionKey="solovision-coo"

# create memory lane
openclaw session memory create --sessionKey="solovision-coo" --name="solovision-coo"

# repeat for CFO, CMP, DEV, Family Coordinator
```

3. **Register tools/scopes per agent:**  
   Use `openclaw session tool allow` (and optionally `openclaw session tool deny`) to give each session access only to the tools you want (e.g., shell for DEV, no shell for CFO). Example:

```bash
openclaw session tool allow --sessionKey="solovision-dev" --tool="shell"
openclaw session tool allow --sessionKey="solovision-dev" --tool="gateway"
openclaw session tool deny --sessionKey="solovision-cfo" --tool="shell"
```

4. **(Optional) Configure onboarding prompts or personas per session:**  
   Use `openclaw session prompt set <sessionKey>` to load the persona you crafted, and `openclaw session memory push` to seed the memory lane.

[Thinking: **Preparing to respond with general instructions**...]
The control-plane token lives wherever your OpenClaw deployment stores privileged API credentials. Usually that‚Äôs:

1. **OpenClaw config file** ‚Äî check `/home/node/.openclaw/config.json` or similar; look for an `apiToken` or `controlPlaneToken`.
2. **Coolify environment variables** ÔøΩÔøΩ go into the Coolify dashboard, open the OpenClaw app, and look under ÔøΩÔøΩEnvironmentÔøΩÔøΩ for a variable like `OPENCLAW_CONTROL_TOKEN` / `OPENCLAW_SESSION_TOKEN`. ThatÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩs the token you inject into the sessionÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩs shell before running the CLI.
3. **Secrets vault or admin console** ‚Äî if you have an admin UI, the control-plane token might be stored there; ask whoever set up OpenClaw for the ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩcontrol plane API key.ÔøΩÔøΩ

Once you locate it, export it before running the CLI:
```bash
export OPENCLAW_TOKEN=eyJhbGciOiJ...
```
If you can‚Äôt find it, let me know what admin tools you have access to (Coolify UI, config files, etc.) and I can walk you through retrieving it.

[Thinking: **Explaining token differences**...]
Not necessarilyÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩyour gateway token lets the dashboard talk to the OpenClaw gateway (gateway API). The control-plane token is a separate credential that lets a session create memories, sessions, and manage tools. They can be the same value if youÔøΩÔøΩve configured them that way, but they‚Äôre often different for security.

If the Coolify environment already exposes a `GATEWAY_TOKEN` (or similar) and youÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩre not sure whether it doubles as the control-plane token, you can try exporting it as `OPENCLAW_TOKEN` and see if the CLI calls succeed. If they fail with ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩpermission deniedÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ or ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩunauthorized,ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ then itÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩs not the same token.

So try this:
```bash
export OPENCLAW_TOKEN=<your gateway token from Coolify>
openclaw session list
```
If that command works, you‚Äôve got the right token. If it errors, weÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩll need to source the actual control-plane token from whoever deployed OpenClaw or create one via the admin interface.

GreatÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩthanks for running the search and confirming the gateway token. Now that the CLI is working, hereÔøΩÔøΩs the concrete command sequence you can run (in the same shell where you exported `OPENCLAW_TOKEN=ec29b5f96d0e70bcbc97fb46e2e3c226615e0a5f709942edec54aa3939374631`) to create the five isolated agents, each with its own workspace and memory lane:

### 1. Create the five agents
```bash
moltbot agents add --model="openai-codex/gpt-5.2" --workspace="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/solovision-coo/workspace" --agent-dir="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/solovision-coo/agent" solovision-coo
moltbot agents add --model="openai-codex/gpt-5.2" --workspace="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/solovision-cfo/workspace" --agent-dir="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/solovision-cfo/agent" solovision-cfo
moltbot agents add --model="openai-codex/gpt-5.2" --workspace="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/solovision-cmp/workspace" --agent-dir="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/solovision-cmp/agent" solovision-cmp
moltbot agents add --model="openai-codex/gpt-5.2" --workspace="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/solovision-dev/workspace" --agent-dir="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/solovision-dev/agent" solovision-dev
moltbot agents add --model="openai-codex/gpt-5.2" --workspace="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/family-coordinator/workspace" --agent-dir="/home/node/.openclaw/agents/family-coordinator/agent" family-coordinator
```

### 2. Create the dedicated memory lanes
```bash
moltbot memory push --agent=solovision-coo --name=solovision-coo --text="COO memory lane: operations, roadmaps, SOPs."
moltbot memory push --agent=solovision-cfo --name=solovision-cfo --text="CFO memory lane: financial health, forecasts, risk tracking."
moltbot memory push --agent=solovision-cmp --name=solovision-cmp --text="CMP memory lane: product positioning, messaging, competitor insights."
moltbot memory push --agent=solovision-dev --name=solovi
Pre-compaction memory flush. Store durable memories now (use memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md; create memory/ if needed). If nothing to store, reply with NO_REPLY.

# AGENTS.md ÔøΩÔøΩ Operating Guide (Always-Loaded)

## Task Board Protocol (MANDATORY)

**All work MUST be tracked on the dashboard task board.**

**Script:** `python3 /home/node/.openclaw/workspace-dev/scripts/dashboard-tasks.py`

### Commands
```bash
# Add task (assign to appropriate agent)
python3 scripts/dashboard-tasks.py add "Task title" --agent main --priority 1 --desc "Details"

# Move task
python3 scripts/dashboard-tasks.py move <task_id> progress
python3 scripts/dashboard-tasks.py done <task_id>

# List your tasks
python3 scripts/dashboard-tasks.py list --agent main

# Reassign task to different agent
python3 scripts/dashboard-tasks.py update <task_id> --agent dev
```

### Agent Assignment Rules
When creating tasks, assign to the **most appropriate agent**:
| Agent | Assign tasks for... |
|-------|---------------------|
| **DEV** | Code, APIs, integrations, automation, infrastructure, deployments |
| **EXEC** | Coordination, planning, strategy, cross-team initiatives |
| **COO** | Operations, processes, delivery, roadmaps |
| **CFO** | Finance, budgets, expenses, revenue tracking |
| **CMP** | Marketing strategy, product positioning, messaging |
| **SMM** | Social media posts, content creation, engagement |
| **SEC** | Security audits, access reviews, compliance |
| **FAMILY** | Household, family logistics, personal scheduling |
| **TAX** | Tax prep, filings, deductions |
| **MAIN** | General tasks, unclear ownership |

### Rules
1. **Create task BEFORE starting work** (move to progress)
2. **Move to done when complete**
3. **Never leave stale tasks** in progress
4. **Assign to the right agent** ‚Äî if unsure, assign to EXEC for triage
5. **Log activity** for significant work

---

## Startup (every session)
1) Read **SOUL.md** (operating rules)
2) Read **USER.md** (who youÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩre helping)
3) Read **RUNNING-CONTEXT.md** (current state)
4) Read `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md` (today + yesterday)
5) If main 1:1 session: read **MEMORY.md**

## Scope + routing
- **Wrong agent / wrong role:** reply with `WRONG_AGENT ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ` + your scope + who to route to.
- **External actions:** ask first for emails/posts/payments or anything leaving the machine.

## Group chat hygiene (short)
- Reply only if asked/mentioned or you add real value.
- Prefer one thoughtful reply over multiple fragments.

## Where procedures live
- Heartbeat checklist: **HEARTBEAT.md**
- Long SOPs / credentials: `references/context/` (not always-loaded)
- Non-trivial work: use **compound-workflows** skill (file-first plans/reviews/learnings).

# 2026-02-03 Daily Log

## Claudebot/Clawdbot Improvements
- Documented the five productivity tips from the video: protecting memory (flush + session search), routing work through specialized muscles, brain dump + expectation-setting, reverse prompting, and having Claudebot build tooling for itself. Saved it as `CLAWBOT-TIPS.md` so the team can quickly copy the prompts and behaviors.
- Noted in RUNNING-CONTEXT that the memory config (compaction/memorySearch) must stay untouched after the earlier fix.
- Logged keyboard to leave the current config as-is and use the new documentation for prompt references rather than re-editing the gateway config directly.

## Memory Viewer
- Restored the modal to a pre-based viewer (wrapped in a container) so Markdown spacing is preserved. Added helpers that swap the view pre for an editable textarea on demand while keeping the version history, bot-update badge, and acknowledgement features from the latest commit.
- Updated the code so the other ‚ÄúViewÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ window now uses the same pre-renderer, and bumped the docs-hub script query string to `v=2.7.0` so both dashboards fetch the new bundle.

## Dashboard State
- Auto-backups now run inside `dashboard-main` every time the state JSON is saved, copying the latest snapshot into `dashboard-backups/` and pruning old copies so there‚Äôs always a most recent file to rely on.
- `scripts/restore-dashboard-state.sh` now prefers the newest local backup before falling back to Google Drive, meaning restores will always grab the freshest taskboard snapshot.

## Timezone
- The dashboard server and backup scripts now default to `America/New_York` so all timestamps (task saves, logs, and job cron output) align with EST as requested.

## Task Tracking
- Whenever SoLo asks me to do something in chat, I add it to the task board (To-Do for queued work, In Progress when actively working) to keep the history accurate.

## Memory Viewer
- Fixed the ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩMark as Read‚Äù flow so only the targeted card loses its badge, and the list refresh now clears the cache before re-rendering, preventing the entire memory list from looking read after acknowledging a single file.

## Task Momentum
- Promise only when actively working: I now log a terminal entry at the exact moment I start a task, describe real progress, and never leave a gap that looks like ‚ÄúwaitingÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ without explaining what happened, so SoLo always sees the work stream live.

## Chat Input
- Replaced the one-line chat input with a textarea so multi-line tags/notes can be typed inline. Ctrl/Cmd+Enter now submits while Shift+Enter adds a newline, and I store and restore the caret position on blur->focus so you return to the same spot rather than jumping to the end.
- Added wrap-friendly styling (white-space: pre-wrap, break-word, wrap="soft") so long lines flow down instead of stretching past the input.

## Personas
- Rebuilt `PERSONAS.md` to match OpenClawÔøΩÔøΩs template and focused on the five agents you requested (COO, CFO, CMP, DEV, Family Coordinator) so every line now ties to the OpenClaw workflow before any research or write-up.

memoryFiles.content:
# 2026-01-31 - Major Dashboard & Persistence Fixes

## Key Accomplishments

### Dashboard Sidebar & Memory Page
- Added collapsible sidebar navigation (64px collapsed, 200px expanded)
- Created dedicated Memory page for viewing/editing memory files
- Tabs: Dashboard, Memory, Chat, Products, Settings
- Memory files now display with categories (Core Identity, Guides, Daily Logs)

### Data Persistence Finally Fixed!
- **Root cause**: Coolify ignores docker-compose volumes, requires UI configuration
- **Solution**: Added persistent storage via Coolify UI:
  - `/app/data` - Dashboard state (tasks, notes, gateway config)
  - `/app/memory` - Mounted from OpenClaw workspace (live memory files!)
- Volume names cannot have spaces (caused deploy failures)
- Gateway settings now persist by storing in server state AND localStorage

### Memory Files Integration
- Dashboard now reads LIVE files from OpenClaw workspace via mount
- 18 memory files accessible: SOUL.md, USER.md, MEMORY.md, AGENTS.md, TOOLS.md, HEARTBEAT.md, IDENTITY.md, daily logs, etc.
- Edit in dashboard ‚Üí updates my actual workspace files
- No more sync needed - direct mount!

### Cron Jobs Set Up
1. **Memory Backup to Google Drive** - Daily at 4 AM EST
2. **Google Drive Cleanup** - 1st of month, keeps 30 days + monthly archives
3. **Sync Memory Files to Dashboard** - Every hour (may be redundant now with mount)

### Google Drive Backup
- Backup folder: `1VEOcQA_bgfPmwDhYHd1lqMzZom1sO869`
- Includes all memory files as tar.gz
- Monthly archives preserved permanently

## Technical Details

### Coolify Persistent Storage Config
```
Dashboard app ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ Configuration ‚Üí Persistent Storage:
- Volume: appdata ‚Üí /app/data (dashboard state)
- Volume: SoLoBot Memory ‚Üí /app/memory (OpenClaw workspace mount)
  Source: /var/lib/docker/volumes/a88sw4go8wc8wo4k4okg48cs_moltbot-openclaw/_data/workspace
```

### Files Modified
- `docker-compose.coolify.yml` - Simplified, Coolify manages volumes via UI
- `server.js` - Memory API endpoints, path fixes
- `dashboard.js` - Gateway persistence, sidebar navigation
- `index.html` - Sidebar UI, Memory page, new CSS
- `docs-hub-memory-files.js` - Fetches live files from API

## Issues Resolved
- Data loss on every Coolify redeploy (fixed with persistent storage)
- Gateway settings not persisting (fixed - stored in server state)
- Memory files not showing (fixed - mount path corrected)
- JavaScript error in renderDocs (fixed - null check added)
- Volume name with space causing deploy failure (fixed - renamed)

## Gateway Config (Saved)
- Host: solobot.sololink.cloud
- Port: 443
- Session: main
- Token: Stored in server state

## Next Steps
- Complete USER.md interview
- Create branded PDF report template
- Test persistence across more deploys
- Expand Chat and Products pages

# SoLoStandBy Research Notes

## What it is
- Android "StandBy mode" inspired by Apple's StandBy: turns idle phones into glanceable, clock-and-info surfaces.
- Status: currently "in review" (per MEMORY.md) with assets, screenshots, and APKs already in Drive.
- App package name and resources are in Drive (`resources.txt` shows theme values, colors `brand_navy`, `brand_red`, and `Theme_SoLoStandby`).

## Primary Drive sources
1. **Project folder:** `SoLoStandBy` (`https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1VjlJRWYHsMsqwya__M16F0PGa3A8xZPw`).  Contains:
   - Screenshots and screen recordings from Jan 2026 (`SoLoStandBy Screenshots`, `screen-*.mp4`).
   - Troubleshooting folder with supplementary screenshots and a `Test` subfolder.
   - `APKs` folder (`id 180_p_jO1-BF8gSnRzU4Eg9ZftpPR4UyY`) for builds.
   - `App Store Key`, `Permissions Video`, and `configuration.txt` (map of preferences) for marketing/legal reference.
2. **Branding assets:** `SoLoStandBy Branding` includes logo families (v2, v3) and zipped favicon bundle; all nested under `1n6w7cFDmd-o6gWBZSe1zfIGKA7BmThhc`.
3. **Competitor tracking:** `COMPETITOR-TRACKING.md` (`https://drive.google.com/file/d/1FXG2jt4TNQ82xTc-5pz8H1xNeFmtc0nR/view?usp=drivesdk`) has dedicated section for SoLoStandBy with:
   - StandBy Mode Pro (100K+ downloads) features: clocks, weather, photo slideshows, AOD/premium tier.
   - Notes on Always On Display (Samsung) and Glance as indirect competitors.
   - Action items: monthly monitoring of StandBy apps, weekly Play Store review.
4. **Resources map:** `resources.txt` (`https://drive.google.com/file/d/1x3jBTwp15Nh-l8vcip7bUf12aBH4bt7e/view?usp=drivesdk`) documents nearly all resource IDs, colors, strings, and highlight `Theme_SoLoStandby` and brand colors (brand_navy/brand_red/brand_white) that should appear in marketing creative.
5. **Binary:** Raw file `solostandby` (`1pVfKn4dbqJ6MyBe7c-9Q8uWC4YIs5_iA`) looks like a build artifact for distribution or side-load guidance.

## Marketing / posting reference
- Differentiators to highlight (per docs + product intent): cross-device ("works on any Android"), polished StandBy-like UI, flexible display modes (clock, weather, photo slideshows), iOS-grade aesthetics, and brand identity.
- Mention competitor pain points: StandBy Mode Pro is ad-supported premium; Samsung/Glance are OEM-locked‚ÄîSoLo can own the stand-alone experience and brand voice.
- Assets ready: logos (v2/v3), screenshots, video for permissions, and key color palette from `resources.txt`.

## Next steps
- When prepping social/collateral, pull specific screenshots from the folder and reuse the names/IDs to ensure variants match the drive content (e.g., `Screenshot (Jan 25, 2026 10 23 12 PM).png`).
- Check `SoLoStandBy Troubleshooting` folder for fix notes before pushing updates or responding to support asks.
- Use competitor doc's action items as ongoing checklist; update it monthly during the audit workflow.

*Logged 2026-02-02 after first drive pass; update whenever new assets or story points appear.*

# 2026-02-05

## Dashboard Fixes (DEV)

### Avatar Path Fix (commit 6a60e1c)
- **Root cause:** Relative paths broke on SPA routes (e.g., `/chat/avatars/x.png` instead of `/avatars/x.png`)
- **Fix:** Changed all avatar paths to absolute (`/avatars/...`)
- Fixed favicon and logo paths too

### Session Visibility Feature (commit 3ba505b)
- **Problem:** When Main spawns a task for DEV, session key is `agent:main:subagent:...` ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ doesn't show in DEV's dropdown
- **Solution A (Label-based filtering):** Dashboard now shows subagent sessions under the agent if the label starts with that agent's ID
  - Example: `agent:main:subagent:abc123` with label `dev-avatar-fix` shows under DEV's dropdown
- **Solution B (URL parameter):** `?session=agent:main:subagent:...` auto-connects to that session
- Added `window.goToSession(key)` and `window.getSessionUrl(key)` helper functions

## Critical Config Fix

### Issue Found
After server reboot, default session was `agent:tax:main` instead of main. Investigation revealed:
- **agents.list only contained TAX** ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ all other agents (main, exec, coo, cfo, cmp, dev, family) were wiped

# 2026-01-30 - Major Dashboard Development Day

## SoLoVision Dashboard - Major Updates (v2.0 ÔøΩÔøΩ v2.8)

### Features Built Today:
1. **v2.0 - Bulk Actions** - Checkboxes, multi-select, bulk move/delete with floating action bar
2. **v2.1 - Drag & Drop** - Drag tasks between columns
3. **v2.2 - Archive** - Archive column (later moved to modal)
4. **v2.3 - Themed Modals** - Replaced browser prompt() with custom styled modals
5. **v2.4 - Persistent Local State** - Fixed issue where server overwrote local changes every 10s
6. **v2.5 - SoLoBot Live Panel** - Real-time status display (later replaced)
7. **v2.6 - Settings Page** - Configurable options (pickup freq, refresh, panels, etc.)
8. **v2.7 - Terminal Console** - Terminal-style log viewer for real-time activity
9. **v2.8 - VPS Sync** - Real-time sync to VPS server

### Infrastructure Set Up:
- **Sync Server**: `solovision-sync.service` running on VPS port 3456
- **API Endpoints**:
  - GET `/api/state` - Current dashboard state
  - POST `/api/sync` - Sync state from browser
  - GET `/api/notify` - Check for pending notifications
- **Cron**: "VPS Dashboard Sync Check" every 60 seconds

### Key Issues Encountered:
1. Browser cache not loading new versions ‚Üí Added cache-busting `?v=X.X.X`
2. Server state overwriting local changes ÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩÔøΩ Added `localModified` flag
3. JS syntax error (stray backtick) broke dashboard
4. Archive column unwanted ÔøΩÔøΩ Moved to modal popup
5. VPS port 8080 blocked externally ‚Üí Used port 3456 for sync API

### SoLo's Feedback/Preferences:
- Wants terminal-style logs to see what I'm doing (not just status panel)
- Wants instant notification on every change
- Doesn't want Archive as a column, prefers modal
- Prefers themed UI over browser prompts

### Current State:
- Dashboard on GitHub Pages: https://solovision24.github.io/solobot-dashboard/
- Sync API: http://51.81.202.92:3456/api/state
- **Issue**: SoLo's browser needs hard refresh to get v2.8 sync code
- Tasks in progress not syncing because old code loaded

### Cron Jobs Active:
- VPS Dashboard Sync Check (60s) - checks for changes
- Dashboard Heartbeat (30min) - proactive checks
- Email Monitor (10min)
- Morning Pulse (7 AM EST daily)
- Weekly Audit (Sunday 8 PM EST)

### Disabled:
- Dashboard Task Pickup (was 60s, too token-heavy)

- SoLo = Jeremy Smith, Tech Coordinator (school district)
- Works late nights, early mornings
- 5 products: SoLoLink, SoLoRecall, SoLoVoice, SoLoFamilyPlan, SoLoStandBy
- Goal: $200k/year to quit day job, short-term few thousand/month extra

## Google Drive

- Structure: 01-Projects, 02-Notes, 03-Reports, 04-Research, 05-Reference

## Next Steps:
1. Get SoLo on v2.8 (hard refresh needed)

## Competitors Researched:

**StandBy apps (SoLoStandBy):** StandBy Mode Pro (100K+ downloads, main competitor)
